family.name: Lenz Plus decoders released March 2010
family.comment: Decoders featuring Precision Braking Control and Low Gear Switching Drive

variable.label: Maximum Speed
variable.comment: Sets the maximum voltage at full throttle

variable.label: Manufacturer ID - Reset
variable.comment: Writing a value of 8 or 33 will reset decoder to factory defaults

variable.label: Consist Address (0-127)
variable.comment: Stores consist address. Range 0-127 (direction set in bit 7)

variable.label: Consist Direction
variable.comment: A consist address over 127 will also set this bit

variable.label: Loco can operate on conventional DC
Constant braking distance with speed step 0
Dimming Intensity, Output A (0-255)
variable.tooltip: CV55 - Sets intensity of dimmed headlight (larger number = brighter light)

variable.label: Dimming Intensity, Output B (0-255)
variable.tooltip: CV56 - Sets intensity of dimmed headlight (larger number = brighter light)

variable.label: Enter the value corresponding to the desired lighting effect for B/A outputs (0-44)

Flashing frequency for outputs C and D (255 = .13 Hz, 32 = 1 Hz, 15 = 2 Hz, 0 = 33 Hz)
variable.tooltip: Flashing rate, default = 1 sec, f= 1/(.03* 1 + value))

label.label: light dimming for A and B outputs:
lighting effects on/off for outputs A and B:
lighting effects on/off for outputs C and D:
To tie an output to a F1 forward or backward, add in the value of the letter:A=1; B=2; C=4; D=8; E=16
Note that the range for each Function entry is 0 to 31.
To tie an output to a Function, add in the value of the letter:A=1; B=2; C=4; D=8; E=16
Note that the range for each Function entry is 0 to 31.
To tie an output to a F1 forward or backward, add in the value of the letter:A=1; B=2; C=4; D=8; E=16
Note that the range for each Function entry is 0 to 31.
Tip: Constant Braking only works when momementum is enabled, and when not in switching gear
The CV values on this page are unique in that each CV represents the lighting selection for two different outputs.
The tens digit of the value corresponds to one output, and the ones digit corresponds to the other output.
Example: A value of 23 below results in a Gyra light at output B and a strobe at output A.
available for outputs A and B
